result.execSummary:
The defendant Jimmy Darnell Winters was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
Huber for work only. Court advises the defendant
any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance, alcohol forfeits the release privileges.

miscConds.notes: No violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause. No illegally controlled substances; random screening.

Pay a fine of $100 plus costs, assessments and surcharges or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant. Court orders defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge, if not already done.
Court advises defendant he cannot possess firearms and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jimmy Darnell Winters

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Also referenced ATN #41004906057172, arrest date 3-17-14, MPD.

Sentencing proceeds.   Statements by counsel and defendant.  

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample if not previously provided and pay the DNA surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 90 days at the House of Correction with Huber for work only and 2 days credit.  COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of 18 months.

CONDITIONS:  1) no violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay a fine of $100 plus costs, assessments and surcharges or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant; 3) no illegally controlled substances; 4) random screening; 5) AODA,  treatment or program; 6) maintain employment.

Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance, alcohol forfeits the release privileges. 

COURT ORDERS:
- defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge, if not already done. 

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copy given to the defendant.

Defendant Jimmy Darnell Winters in court with attorney Mary G Guimont.  Dax C Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant Jimmy Darnell Winters in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Dax C. Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds
  Plea hearing scheduled for April 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant Jimmy Darnell Winters in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Dax C. Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 3/26/14.
css

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jimmy Darnell Winters in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Jimmy Darnell Winters in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 27, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
